responses: Hi, how can I assist you?

patterns: What are the requirements for admission?
What do I need to apply for admission?
responses: To apply for admission, you need to provide your high school transcripts, standardized test scores, and a personal statement. We also consider extracurricular activities and letters of recommendation. Would you like more details about any of these requirements?

The admission requirements include submitting your high school transcripts, standardized test scores, and a personal statement. We also consider extracurricular activities and letters of recommendation. If you need more information about any of these requirements, I can provide you with the details.

You will need to provide your high school transcripts, standardized test scores, and a personal statement to apply for admission. We also consider extracurricular activities and letters of recommendation. If you have any questions about these requirements, feel free to ask me.

patterns: What is the deadline for submitting my application?
When do I need to apply?
When is the last date to apply?
responses: The application deadline is usually in January. However, I would recommend checking the university's website for the exact deadline.
The deadline for submitting your application is usually in January. However, I suggest you check the university's website for the exact date.
You need to apply before the January deadline to be considered for admission. Please check the university's website for the exact date.

patterns: How much is the tuition fee?
What is the cost of tuition?
How much does it cost to attend this university?
What is the tuition fee for international students?
responses: The tuition fee varies depending on the program you are applying to and whether you are a domestic or international student. Please check the university's website for more information.

The cost of tuition depends on several factors, such as your program of study and your residency status. For specific details about the tuition fee, I would recommend checking the university's website.
The tuition fee varies depending on your program of study and your residency status. You can find more information about the cost of attending our university on our website.

patterns: I want to hear a joke
responses: Why did the physics professor break up with the biology professor? There was no chemistry between them.
Why did the math book look sad? Because it had too many problems.
What do you get when you cross a snowman and a math teacher? Frosted math lessons.
Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything.
Why did the professor bring a ladder to class? To reach the highest level of education.
Why did the biology professor become a stand-up comedian? He had a natural sense of humorus.
Why did the computer science professor get a virus? He forgot to wash his hands before coding.
Why did the psychology professor refuse to tell jokes? He was afraid his punchlines might trigger someone.
Why did the literature professor go to jail? For excessive use of symbolism.
Why did the philosophy professor fail the ethics exam? Because he stole the answers from his neighbor's conscience.
